list_definition.definition: a person, animal or thing supposed to bring good luck

list_ex_of_english: In the middle is the marionette built during the project, which came to serve as its mascot.
I understand that most mascots of that nature nowadays are lightly sprung and do not cause the injuries that occurred previously.
At present 10 regiments are authorised to keep regimental mascots.
The costs of purchasing officially recognised mascots, together with the cost of food, accommodation and ceremonial accoutrements, are met privately by regimental associations.
Will he not stop the practice of awarding medals of this character to animals, even though the animals are regimental mascots?
The ever-present figure of a human bull-dog perpetually smoking a cigar has become a symbol of tenacity of purpose and a mascot of good luck to the freedom-loving world.
Finally, there is the regulation concerning mascots.
I understand that one is no longer allowed to have a mascot in a dangerous position at the front of a car.
